CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft 365: Information Barriers (IB) upgrading from IB v1 to IB v2 with new capabilities
CurrentVersion.description: Information Barriers (IB) V2 brings new capabilities including larger segment scale support, multi-segment support, and flexible people discoverability etc. Existing IB v1 tenants require an upgrade to IB v2 to take advantage of these new capabilities. This roadmap item is intended only for all IB v1 customers. All other customers will get IB v2 capabilities when they enable IB in their tenants. IB v2 upgrade will be opt-in.

CurrentVersion.description: Now, meeting organizers can make the list of breakout rooms visible to all meeting participants and allow them to choose which room to join. Enabling this setting in breakout rooms allows participants to move freely from one room to another, simplifying breakout room coordination for meeting organizers and participants.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Defender for Office 365: Auto-Remediation of Malicious Entity Clusters Identified in Automated Investigation and Response (AIR)
CurrentVersion.description: The feature will expand upon the automated investigation and response (AIR) by enabling AIR to automatically remediate malicious entity clusters. AIR currently recommends actions for SecOps to approve or decline and this enhancement will allow customers to enable auto-remediation to allow AIR to act on recommendations and soft delete messages included in a malicious URL or malicious file cluster.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Copilot in Meetings will suggest follow up questions to ask it
CurrentVersion.description: When Copilot in Teams Meetings responds to a prompt, it will also suggest follow ups to keep the conversation going. These questions will generally be based on the response it gave prior, and could be related to honing in on a particular topic, asking for more details, or asking what a particular person said during the meeting.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Copilot in Teams can analyze content shared on-screen during a meeting
CurrentVersion.description: Now, Copilot in Teams can analyze content shared on-screen during a meeting when recording is enabled. This, along with meeting transcript and meeting chat, enables users to ask Copilot to summarize or find specific information from screen-shared content (e.g., ‘Which products had the highest sales?’), consolidate insights across both the conversation and presentation (e.g., 'What was the feedback per slide?'), and draft new content based on the entire meeting (e.g., 'Rewrite the paragraph shared on the screen incorporating the feedback from the chat’). This works for any content shared while sharing your desktop screen (including but not limited to documents, slides, spreadsheets, and websites, irrespective of platform or app). Support for PowerPoint Live and Whiteboard in Teams will be available at a later date.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Insider Risk Management - Adaptive Protection
CurrentVersion.description:
Adaptive Protection is a capability of Microsoft Purview that dynamically assigns appropriate Data Loss Prevention policies to users based on the risk levels analyzed by the machine learning models in Insider Risk Management. 

Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management correlates various signals to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks, such as IP theft, data leakage, and security violations. Insider Risk Management enables customers to create policies to manage security and compliance. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy.

Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management correlates various signals to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks, such as IP theft, data leakage, and security violations. Insider Risk Management enables customers to create policies to manage security and compliance. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Defender for Office 365: AIR Initiated Remediation Logging
CurrentVersion.description: The AIR attribution update will empower customers with enhanced insights by deciphering between remediations produced by AIR versus truly manual remediations initiated independently by SecOps teams. Presently, all actions produced by AIR and approved by SecOps are logged as manual remediations throughout the portal. With this update, messages that are remediated as a result of approval of an AIR action will be logged as SecOps approved automated actions.

CurrentVersion.title: Outlook: Updating Conversation Actions on Outlook for iOS
CurrentVersion.description:
After further review we have decided not to proceed with this change at this time. We apologize for any inconvenience. Currently, when viewing a message, you can access the available actions in the top-right corner. We are updating these actions to be at the bottom of the screen with the ability to customize the order and placement of the actions to suit your needs. With this update, you will also be able to access all conversation actions from the inbox view by long-pressing a message.

Feature ID: 398983

CurrentVersion.title: Outlook: First phase of PST support in new Outlook for Windows
CurrentVersion.description: The first phase PST (a.k.a. Outlook Data File) support in the new Outlook for Windows provides read-only access to Mail items within *.pst files. Users will be able to open *.pst files, read their emails within *.pst files, and search *.pst files for emails. All Calendar, Contacts, and Tasks data saved in the *.pst files are still there, but they cannot be accessed in this preview. Next releases will expand PST support capabilities. #newoutlookforwindows

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Notification in Activity feed and banner when intelligent meeting recap is ready
CurrentVersion.description: Intelligent meeting recap users will receive a notification in Teams Activity feed and banner when intelligent meeting recap is ready. Clicking on the notification in Activity feed will take users right to the intelligent meeting recap experience, which will be visible to the right of the Activity feed. Users can configure their notification settings in Teams settings > Notifications and activity > Apps > Meeting Recap to control where the notification is surfaced (Activity and banner, Activity only, Off) as well as which meetings have notifications enabled (for only meetings with RSVP selection of “Follow,” or all other meetings, or both).

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Meeting organizers can turn off copying or forwarding of live captions, transcript, and recap for meetings (Premium)
CurrentVersion.description: We are expanding the existing ‘Turn off copying or forwarding of meeting chat’ control for meeting organizers to include live captions, transcription, and meeting recap. With this change, meeting organizers with eligible licenses will see a control called ‘Turn off copying and forwarding of meeting chat, live captions, and transcript’ in the meeting options. When this control is enabled, meeting participants won’t be able to copy the meeting chat, live captions, live transcript, or any insights generated from intelligent meeting recap.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Edge: Elevating top settings and improving settings page navigability
CurrentVersion.description: To make finding browser settings more efficient, Microsoft Edge is introducing three navigation improvements to Edge Settings. We are making no changes to the functionality of any setting and all settings will remain on the same page as they are today but will be behind clickable sections. The first is introducing quick access to the most used actions on the landing page of Edge Settings. Second, each densely populated page—Privacy, search, and services; Appearance; Cookies and site permissions; System and performance—will feature quick access to its most used actions. Third, for these same pages, each section will now click-through to its respective sub-settings (similar to a table of contents).

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: eDiscovery - EXPORT ENHANCEMENTS
CurrentVersion.description: With the export of data being one of the core fundamentals of the solution, Microsoft Purview eDiscovery team is excited to announce significant changes coming to the export feature along with the new user experience in purview.microsoft.com. Key changes with export enhancements: The biggest change being introduced is that with the new user experience for eDiscovery where Standard and Premium cases have unified structure, the export is also aligned for both the streams – thereby providing a singular experience to customers. The behavior is now unified across all export jobs - same download experience, some report experience, same error messages. For Standard customers, the need to install a clickonce application in their machine and use that tool to download data for exporting in azure storage is history. Now, in the new experience, customers don’t need to install the app anymore and can download directly through browser. Additionally, customers will experience a faster export capability in the new portal driven through enhancements in backend architecture and optimized partition.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Data Security Posture Management for AI
CurrentVersion.description:
Microsoft Purview AI Hub is released to general availability. Along with this release, the name has been rebranded to Microsoft Purview Data Security Posture Management for AI (DSPM for AI) and capabilities have been added that include supporting admin units, displaying AI policies that were created in Purview solutions, and supporting additional AI apps. A version of DSPM for AI is also available to additional licensing, specifically Microsoft 365 E3 and Microsoft 365 Copilot licenses. 

The AI hub in Microsoft Purview is a centralized location to gain insights into generative AI activity, including the sensitive data flowing in AI prompts, both for Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365 and non-Microsoft AI applications.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Insider Risk Management - New Insider Risk Management reporting capabilities
CurrentVersion.description:
Insider risk management is introducing one central location for all reports including analytics and user activity reports. Additional reports will also be available that will summarize trends in alerts generated and cases created. Sample reports include alerts generated over time, alerts actioned over time, alerts and cases generated by region and department, top triggering events of alerts generated, and average time to triage alerts and cases.

The ability to filter reports will also be introduced. 

Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management correlates various signals to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks, such as IP theft, data leakage, and security violations. Insider Risk Management enables customers to create policies based on their own internal policies, governance, and organizational requirements. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft 365 admin center: New Feature access management UI in Admin Center
CurrentVersion.description: Through the new Feature Access management user interface, admins will be able to manage feature access settings directly in Microsoft 365 admin center. Feature access management allows admins to use access policies to manage which users can access specific features in Viva apps, so you can tailor your deployments to meet your local regulatory or business requirements. Previously, these policies could only be managed with Microsoft PowerShell cmdlets. After this rollout, admins can choose to use either Microsoft 365 admin center or PowerShell to manage feature access. Existing policies set for an organization will persist and can be managed in both places.

With the latest update, this indicator captures the sensitivity label changes (downgrade/ remove) when performed on OneDrive, AIP, and Endpoint (SharePoint file opened in Office app, or any sensitivity label change on the local files on your device).

Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Insider Risk Management - Downgrade/remove sensitivity label
OldVersion.description:
This feature is an enhancement to the existing IRM Office Indicator. In the current version, only sensitivity label changes on the SharePoint Web app are captured in IRM. With the latest update, this indicator captures the sensitivity label changes (downgrade/ remove) when performed on OneDrive, AIP, and Endpoint (SharePoint file opened in Office app, or any sensitivity label change on the local files on your device).

Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management correlates various signals to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks such as IP theft, data leakage and security violations. Insider Risk Management enables customers to create policies based on their own internal policies, governance and organizational requirements. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Approvals in Teams within DoD
CurrentVersion.description: Users within DoD will now be able to use the Approvals app within Microsoft Teams.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Approvals in Teams within DoD
OldVersion.description: Users within DoD will now be able to use the Approvals app within Microsoft Teams.

CurrentVersion.title: Windows 365: Concurrency assignment for Windows 365 Frontline in dedicated mode
CurrentVersion.description: Concurrency assignment in Windows 365 Frontline in dedicated mode refers to the number of active Cloud PCs that can be used simultaneously within the total number of licensed Cloud PC usage for Frontline. This allocation ensures that resources are optimized based on the specific needs of the organization and its users.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot in Excel with Python for Web
CurrentVersion.description: Using everyday language, ask Copilot to perform advanced analytics that would usually take you hours or is beyond your skillset like machine learning, predictive forecasting, and more. Copilot will write Python code for you and insert it on the grid, resulting in deeper insights and stunning visuals. Available on Excel for the Web in English, Simplified Chinese, French, German, Italian, Japanese, Brazilian Portuguese, and Spanish, with additional languages coming soon.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Endpoint Data Loss Prevention - Microsoft Purview Endpoint DLP blanket protections for unscannable file types
CurrentVersion.description:
Purview Endpoint DLP supports a set of specific file extensions and types. For file extensions not listed in this document, customers must use the 'File extension is' or 'File type is' rule condition. However, this approach can be challenging, as it requires manually enumerate all desired file extensions. This feature will enable protection for files outside the standard Purview Endpoint DLP monitoring scope.
More info: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/purview/dlp-create-deploy-policy?tabs=purview#scenario-3-apply-controls-to-supported-files-that-fail-scanning

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Data Lifecycle Management - Introduction of secure workflow to bypass legal holds and retention policies in Exchange
CurrentVersion.description: The first release of Priority cleanup enables admins to create a recurring exception to delete items under a broader retention policy and/or legal hold on Exchange workload. Creating a Priority cleanup will require a separate security role, multiple approvers, and will have a complete audit trail

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Ad-hoc individual desk booking in Teams
CurrentVersion.description: While previously able to reserve a spot within a desk pool, now you can book an individual desk when plugging into a shared desk peripheral. In addition, IT admins can get valuable individual desk utilization data in the Teams Rooms Pro Management portal making flexible work environments better for users and IT. This feature requires a Teams Premium license.

CurrentVersion.title: Outlook: FSLogix support for the new Outlook for Windows
CurrentVersion.description:
FSLogix support for the new Outlook for Windows includes registering the new Outlook for Windows package by family name and persisting the user data in LocalAppData. It will allow the roaming of user data in new Outlook for non-persistent VDI. #newoutlookforwindows
More info: https://learn.microsoft.com/microsoft-365-apps/outlook/get-started/virtualized-desktop-infrastructure

OldVersion.title: Outlook: FSLogix support for the new Outlook for Windows
OldVersion.description: FSLogix support for the new Outlook for Windows includes registering the new Outlook for Windows package by family name and persisting the user data in LocalAppData. It will allow the roaming of user data in new Outlook for non-persistent VDI. #newoutlookforwindows

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Engage - Community replies and reactions in Teams
CurrentVersion.description: Users with the Viva Engage app in Teams will now receive notifications when others reply or react to their posts.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot extensibility – Developers can build custom engine agents with the Microsoft 365 Agents SDK
CurrentVersion.description: Developers can use the Microsoft 365 Agents SDK to create custom engine agents. These agents, built on their own AI stack, can be deployed to various platforms, including Microsoft 365 Copilot, Microsoft Teams, and other non-Microsoft channels.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot Extensibility -  Automatic project scaffolding in Teams Toolkit for building Graph connectors
CurrentVersion.description: Developers can now leverage an automatic project scaffolding for Graph connector applications within the Teams Toolkit, allowing for the generation of a full production-ready Graph connector application from just an API description file, significantly reducing setup time and complexity.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot extensibility – Developers can use TypeSpec as an authoring experience
CurrentVersion.description: Developers can use TypeSpec as an authoring experience for declarative agents and API plugins in Teams Toolkit.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot extensibility – Copilot Chat developer mode
CurrentVersion.description: Developers can use Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat and enable developer mode to debug.

CurrentVersion.title: Excel: Python in Excel
CurrentVersion.description: Python in Excel allows you to bring the capabilities of Python directly into the Excel grid. As a part of this feature, users with access to Excel for Windows will be able to add Python formulas directly into their workbooks without any installation required. These Python formulas will be run by Excel in a secure container on the Microsoft Cloud with enterprise-level security as a compliant Microsoft 365 connected experience.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Data Loss Prevention- OCR Cost Estimator Support for MAC Endpoints
CurrentVersion.description: OCR Cost Estimator allows you to estimate the potential cost for using Optical Character Recognition. This means that you will no longer be required to set up an Azure Subscription for billing first and can accurately estimate the cost you would have incurred while using OCR. This will help you to identify the optimal configuration settings for OCR as per your requirements. Cost Estimator can be used for 30 days and will not scan images for sensitive content.

CurrentVersion.title: Excel: Refresh queries from Authenticated Data Sources in Excel for the Web
CurrentVersion.description: You can now refresh Power Query data from data sources that require authentication in Excel for the Web.

OldVersion.title: Excel: Refresh queries from Authenticated Data Sources in Excel for the Web
OldVersion.description: You can now refresh Power Query data from data sources that require authentication in Excel for the Web.

CurrentVersion.title: Bookings: ''Cc" functionality to email notifications
CurrentVersion.description: "CC" additional email addresses on confirmation & reminder emails for 1:1 & N:1 appointments.

OldVersion.title: Bookings: ''Cc" functionality to email notifications
OldVersion.description: "Cc" an additional email address on confirmation and reminder emails.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft 365: Information Barriers (IB) upgrading from IB v1 to IB v2 with new capabilities
CurrentVersion.description: Information Barriers (IB) V2 brings new capabilities including larger segment scale support, multi-segment support, and flexible people discoverability etc. Existing IB v1 tenants require an upgrade to IB v2 to take advantage of these new capabilities. This roadmap item is intended only for all IB v1 customers. All other customers will get IB v2 capabilities when they enable IB in their tenants. IB v2 upgrade will be opt-in.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Goals Enhanced Filters and Custom Views
CurrentVersion.description: User can now filter OKRs in entity and explorer pages and save custom views to quickly access views that are most relevant.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Information Protection - New cmdlet for Content Explorer (U.S. Government clouds)
CurrentVersion.description: We apologize for the inconvenience, but this item was updated to Rolling out incorrectly. Thank you for your patience. The Content Explorer Export feature has a limitation of exporting data only after drill down to specific location. This update will allow admins to use a new cmdlet within Security & Compliance PowerShell, Export-ContentExplorerData, to export all rows of data for the content that are scanned and shown on the Content Explorer.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Information Protection - New cmdlet for Content Explorer
CurrentVersion.description: The Content Explorer Export feature has a limitation of exporting data only after drill down to specific location. This update will allow admins to use a new cmdlet within Security & Compliance PowerShell, Export-ContentExplorerData, to export all rows of data for the content that are scanned and shown on the Content Explorer.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: New setting enables meeting participants to move between breakout rooms
CurrentVersion.description: Now, meeting organizers can make the list of breakout rooms visible to all meeting participants and allow them to choose which room to join. Enabling this setting in breakout rooms allows participants to move freely from one room to another, simplifying breakout room coordination for meeting organizers and participants.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: eDiscovery (Premium) - Review set: Advanced filters
CurrentVersion.description: Updates to eDiscovery (Premium) review filters experience that allow admins to construct compound nested filters with either “AND” or “OR” conditions, go back and forth (undo/redo) between different iterations of filters, manage saved filter queries without navigating to a different panel, and use “Is empty/Is not empty” condition for each filter.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Learning - Spell check in Viva Learning search
CurrentVersion.description: User queries will be spell checked and corrected for all in-app Search.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Goals – Improved creation, editability, and saved views in review dashboards
CurrentVersion.description:
Users will save time in preparing for goal review
processes with a simplified review dashboard creation and editing experience,
and the ability to leverage saved views instead of starting from scratch. This item is no longer accurate and is being removed from the roadmap.  We apologize for any inconvenience.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Defender for Office 365: Auto-Remediation of Malicious Entity Clusters Identified in Automated Investigation and Response (AIR)
CurrentVersion.description: The feature will expand upon the automated investigation and response (AIR) by enabling AIR to automatically remediate malicious entity clusters. AIR currently recommends actions for SecOps to approve or decline and this enhancement will allow customers to enable auto-remediation to allow AIR to act on recommendations and soft delete messages included in a malicious URL or malicious file cluster.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Copilot in Meetings will suggest follow up questions to ask it
CurrentVersion.description: When Copilot in Teams Meetings responds to a prompt, it will also suggest follow ups to keep the conversation going. These questions will generally be based on the response it gave prior, and could be related to honing in on a particular topic, asking for more details, or asking what a particular person said during the meeting.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Copilot in Teams can analyze content shared on-screen during a meeting
CurrentVersion.description: Now, Copilot in Teams can analyze content shared on-screen during a meeting when recording is enabled. This, along with meeting transcript and meeting chat, enables users to ask Copilot to summarize or find specific information from screen-shared content (e.g., ‘Which products had the highest sales?’), consolidate insights across both the conversation and presentation (e.g., 'What was the feedback per slide?'), and draft new content based on the entire meeting (e.g., 'Rewrite the paragraph shared on the screen incorporating the feedback from the chat’). This works for any content shared while sharing your desktop screen (including but not limited to documents, slides, spreadsheets, and websites, irrespective of platform or app). Support for PowerPoint Live and Whiteboard in Teams will be available at a later date.

CurrentVersion.title: Outlook: Newsletters
CurrentVersion.description: Newsletters in Outlook enable customers to create, distribute, and track success for their internal email newsletters. This feature will be available in the new Outlook for Windows and the web. #newoutlookforwindows

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Learning – Multilayer structuring, customization, and branding for learning academies
CurrentVersion.description: This feature set brings new functionality to learning academies. Multi-layer structuring allows users to organize content and learning paths under multiple levels. Branding capabilities include the customization of the academy logo and the background image. Customization allows users to hide or show individual components of an academy like featured sets and  learner profile cards.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Insider Risk Management - Adaptive Protection
CurrentVersion.description:
Adaptive Protection is a capability of Microsoft Purview that dynamically assigns appropriate Data Loss Prevention policies to users based on the risk levels analyzed by the machine learning models in Insider Risk Management. 

Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management correlates various signals to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks, such as IP theft, data leakage, and security violations. Insider Risk Management enables customers to create policies to manage security and compliance. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy.

CurrentVersion.title: Reference data from the Microsoft cloud when drafting with Copilot in Word
CurrentVersion.description:
Description & title updated to address a publishing issue, correct description as follows: Draft with Copilot will support attaching rich content from the Microsoft cloud--including emails and meetings--resulting in content that's more contextually relevant.
More info: https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/blog/microsoft365copilotblog/what%E2%80%99s-new-in-microsoft-365-copilot-in-word-at-ignite-2024/4303448

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Information Protection - Save filters for Activity Explorer
CurrentVersion.description: Ability to save the filters applied to Activity Explorer and use them later.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Insider Risk Management - Adaptive Protection in Gov Cloud
CurrentVersion.description: Adaptive Protection will now be available in Government clouds. Adaptive Protection is a capability of Microsoft Purview that dynamically assigns appropriate Data Loss Prevention policies to users based on the risk levels analyzed by the machine learning models in Insider Risk Management. Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management correlates various signals to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks such as IP theft, data leakage, and security violations. Insider Risk Management enables customers to create policies based on their own internal policies, governance, and organizational requirements. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Learning - Date and numeral standardization
CurrentVersion.description: All the dates that appear in Viva Learning will match the layout local to the user. This also applies to standardization of numerals.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Microsoft Purview support for Webinars
CurrentVersion.description: IT admins can leverage Microsoft Purview for eDiscovery and legal hold needs to maintain compliance for webinars.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Learning - Remove recommendations in Recommended to You
CurrentVersion.description: This gives users the ability to remove the recommendations which they do not need in the Recommended to you section.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft 365: "Help me create" in Microsoft 365
CurrentVersion.description: "Help me create" is a content create feature in Microsoft365.com that is powered by Copilot for Microsoft 365. Like Copilot, "Help me create" is built on Microsoft's comprehensive approach to security, compliance, and privacy.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Microsoft Purview support for town hall
CurrentVersion.description: IT admins can leverage Microsoft Purview for eDiscovery and legal hold needs to maintain compliance for town halls.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Glint - Notifications and Nudges in Teams
CurrentVersion.description: Users can receive survey notifications and nudges in Teams

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Video clip in channel
CurrentVersion.description: You can now use Teams video clip in channel, in addition to chat. Record yourself, your screen, or an audio-only clip and attach the video clip to your channel post or reply.

CurrentVersion.title: Outlook: Share to Teams will be added to the ribbon in the new Outlook for Windows
CurrentVersion.description: Users will now be able to find a "Share to Teams" button in the ribbon whenever they select an email in the reading pane. #newoutlookforwindows

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Dashboard personalization on tablet in Viva Connections
CurrentVersion.description: Customize your dashboard by adding, removing, or reordering the dashboard cards.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot for Microsoft 365 now available in the Microsoft Start app
CurrentVersion.description: Users with a Copilot for Microsoft 365 license will be able to receive answers grounded in their organizational Graph data with the Microsoft Start app. The app is available for iOS and Android. This item is being removed from the roadmap as it is no longer accurate. We apologize for any inconvenience.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Defender for Office 365: AIR Initiated Remediation Logging
CurrentVersion.description: The AIR attribution update will empower customers with enhanced insights by deciphering between remediations produced by AIR versus truly manual remediations initiated independently by SecOps teams. Presently, all actions produced by AIR and approved by SecOps are logged as manual remediations throughout the portal. With this update, messages that are remediated as a result of approval of an AIR action will be logged as SecOps approved automated actions.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Learning – Edit Learning Paths in Viva Learning
CurrentVersion.description: Admin will be able to edit learning paths metadata and content. Latest updates will be shown to learner after the LP is edited.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft 365 app: Retention Labels are available for Loop pages and components
CurrentVersion.description: Organizations that rely on Microsoft's records management capabilities in Purview can now include Loop content in their workflows with Retention Labels on Loop pages and components. There's an in-app experience when a label is applied or a record is locked.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Information Protection - Save filters for Activity Explorer
CurrentVersion.description: This adds the ability to save the filters applied to Activity Explorer and use them later.

CurrentVersion.title: Outlook: Updating Conversation Actions on Outlook for iOS
CurrentVersion.description:
After further review we have decided not to proceed with this change at this time. We apologize for any inconvenience. Currently, when viewing a message, you can access the available actions in the top-right corner. We are updating these actions to be at the bottom of the screen with the ability to customize the order and placement of the actions to suit your needs. With this update, you will also be able to access all conversation actions from the inbox view by long-pressing a message.

Feature ID: 398983

CurrentVersion.title: Outlook: First phase of PST support in new Outlook for Windows
CurrentVersion.description: The first phase PST (a.k.a. Outlook Data File) support in the new Outlook for Windows provides read-only access to Mail items within *.pst files. Users will be able to open *.pst files, read their emails within *.pst files, and search *.pst files for emails. All Calendar, Contacts, and Tasks data saved in the *.pst files are still there, but they cannot be accessed in this preview. Next releases will expand PST support capabilities. #newoutlookforwindows

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Intune: Endpoint Privilege Management rules support specifying allowable command arguments
CurrentVersion.description: Endpoint Privilege Management rules support specifying a list of allowable command parameters, ensuring elevation for only the allowed or mandatory arguments.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Custom background on Teams panels
CurrentVersion.description: Administrators can upload and set custom background images for Teams panels through the Teams admin center, enabling them to reflect their organization's branding. This feature will be available for Teams Rooms Pro and Teams Shared Devices licensed panels.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Pulse - Pulse series for continuous feedback supporting AI transformations and change management
CurrentVersion.description: New Pulse series templates are being introduced that are tailored to supporting continuous feedback scenarios for high value use cases such as change management.

CurrentVersion.title: Outlook: Ability to add apps to meetings
CurrentVersion.description: With this update, customers will be able to add apps to their meetings, similar to how they can do that in classic Outlook for Windows. #newoutlookforwindows. We are pausing development of this feature for the time being. We apologize for any inconveniences this may cause.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Notification in Activity feed and banner when intelligent meeting recap is ready
CurrentVersion.description: Intelligent meeting recap users will receive a notification in Teams Activity feed and banner when intelligent meeting recap is ready. Clicking on the notification in Activity feed will take users right to the intelligent meeting recap experience, which will be visible to the right of the Activity feed. Users can configure their notification settings in Teams settings > Notifications and activity > Apps > Meeting Recap to control where the notification is surfaced (Activity and banner, Activity only, Off) as well as which meetings have notifications enabled (for only meetings with RSVP selection of “Follow,” or all other meetings, or both).

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Insights- Copilot for Sales Metrics & PBI Report
CurrentVersion.description: Providing Copilot for Sales metrics for Viva Insights analysts in Advanced insights. Copilot for Sales adoption PBI report to provide a starter template to explore Copilot for Sales adoption across the organization.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft 365 admin center: Microsoft 365 Copilot usage report - Admins can view line of business agent usage
CurrentVersion.description: Admins can view line of business Copilot agent usage in their tenant from the Microsoft 365 admin center.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Endpoint Data Loss Prevention - Cross workload predicate support on Mac Endpoints (File size, partially scannable, etc.)
CurrentVersion.description: With this capability, admins can extend these mentioned predicates to Microsoft Purview DLP for Endpoint: document is unscannable, document didn't complete scanning, document size equals or is greater than, document Property Is, document name contains words or phrases, and document is password protected.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Volume ratio control for language interpretation
CurrentVersion.description: New user setting that enables meeting participants using language interpretation to control the volume ratio between the original meeting audio and the interpretation audio.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Learning - Immersive Inline Play update
CurrentVersion.description: Current Learning Content details and Player page will be combined to give a more immersive consumption experience for users in Viva Learning. The update will impact all content details pages.

CurrentVersion.title: Outlook: Multi-Account Support for Add-Ins and Apps in new Outlook for Windows
CurrentVersion.description: Currently, new Outlook for for Windows supports apps and add-ins for the user's primary account only. We will be enabling apps and add-ins to be supported across all of the accounts added to new Outlook, dynamically switching to the active identity. #newoutlookforwindows

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Participant roster grouping in Teams BYOD meeting rooms
CurrentVersion.description: When participants join a Teams meeting with their laptop in bring your own device (BYOD) meeting rooms, they will appear in the ‘in-room’ participant section of the roster enabling individual identification and meeting intelligence capabilities.

CurrentVersion.title: Outlook: Drag emails into Calendar icon in the app bar to create an event
CurrentVersion.description: Users can drag and drop emails into the Calendar icon on the left app bar of Outlook to create an event. #newoutlookforwindows

CurrentVersion.title: Outlook: Updates to mail sharing functionality with Cloud Policy Service when setting "Turn off sharing recommendation"
CurrentVersion.description: Updates to the office Cloud Policy Service setting "Turn off sharing recommendation" will disable the ability for users to share folders with individual users. Currently, the policy blocked users' ability to update default and anonymous permission levels for shared folders. This functionality will remain and will not be changed. The current policy and how it works with calendar sharing will not be impacted by this change and will remain as implemented. #newoutlookforwindows

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Meeting organizers can turn off copying or forwarding of live captions, transcript, and recap for meetings (Premium)
CurrentVersion.description: We are expanding the existing ‘Turn off copying or forwarding of meeting chat’ control for meeting organizers to include live captions, transcription, and meeting recap. With this change, meeting organizers with eligible licenses will see a control called ‘Turn off copying and forwarding of meeting chat, live captions, and transcript’ in the meeting options. When this control is enabled, meeting participants won’t be able to copy the meeting chat, live captions, live transcript, or any insights generated from intelligent meeting recap.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Edge: Elevating top settings and improving settings page navigability
CurrentVersion.description: To make finding browser settings more efficient, Microsoft Edge is introducing three navigation improvements to Edge Settings. We are making no changes to the functionality of any setting and all settings will remain on the same page as they are today but will be behind clickable sections. The first is introducing quick access to the most used actions on the landing page of Edge Settings. Second, each densely populated page—Privacy, search, and services; Appearance; Cookies and site permissions; System and performance—will feature quick access to its most used actions. Third, for these same pages, each section will now click-through to its respective sub-settings (similar to a table of contents).

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Queues app on Teams phone devices
CurrentVersion.description: Queues app on Teams phone devices enhances call management capabilities by allowing agents to handle incoming calls, view call queues, and manage call history directly from their Teams phone devices, improving efficiency and ensuring effortless communication for agents.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Collaborative call delegation on Teams phone devices
CurrentVersion.description: Teams phone device users will be able to share access to their phone line with a specific group of users, without a structured delegation system. This enables group members to receive calls and initiate calls on behalf of others, enabling a simple and collaborative communication experience.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Custom name for Teams panels
CurrentVersion.description: Admins can use the Teams Rooms Pro Management portal to assign a custom name to their Teams Rooms Pro or Teams Shared Device licensed panels. This new name displays on the panel's home screen, replacing the global address book name that appears in Outlook or Teams.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Speaker recognition and attribution available in additional meeting spaces
CurrentVersion.description: You can now take advantage of speaker recognition and transcript attribution, and AI capabilities in additional meeting spaces, from those equipped with a Teams Room to those relying on a user's PC in a bring you own device (BYOD) room. This feature identifies and attributes people in live transcripts, utilizing a unique voice profile for each participant enabling intelligent recaps and maximum value from Microsoft 365 Copilot in Teams meetings. Users can easily and securely enroll voices via Teams Settings. A Teams Premium license is required on the host desktop in a BYOD room.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Take notes with Copilot in OneNote directly in the flow from the canvas
CurrentVersion.description: Gather and create notes with Copilot in your personal non-shared OneNote notebooks directly on the page.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Quick rewrite, summarize, and to do actions with Copilot on OneNote canvas
CurrentVersion.description: Use Copilot right in your workflow by invoking Copilot to generate a summary, a to-do list, or help you rewrite the content on the page or based on your selection.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Quick rewrite, summarize, and to do actions with Copilot on OneNote canvas
CurrentVersion.description: Use Copilot right in your workflow by invoking Copilot to generate a summary, a to-do list, or help you rewrite the content on the page or based on your selection.

CurrentVersion.title: Outlook: Meeting details card for shared and delegated calendar invites
CurrentVersion.description: Delegates will be able to see the shared calendar event details, including the principal calendar, in the meeting details card on meeting invite messages. This feature will be available in the new Outlook for Windows and web #newoutlookforwindows

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Event Chat for town halls (Premium)
CurrentVersion.description: Previously in a town hall, only presenters and organizers could chat with each other. With this new update, attendees, presenters and organizers can now chat together during a town hall using the new Event Chat feature. Presenters and organizers can still chat privately during the town hall as well. A Teams Premium license is required for the organizer role to deploy this feature within town hall instances.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Engage - User-level mute
CurrentVersion.description: The mute user feature will allow users to remove other users' posts from their feeds and digests. Users cannot mute designated leaders. Muting a user does not block notifications or at-mentions from that user. Admins can turn this feature on or off for the entire network.

CurrentVersion.title: Outlook: Choose between Copilot Business Chat with web or work grounding
CurrentVersion.description: In Outlook for iOS and Android, you will soon be able to choose whether Microsoft 365 Copilot Business Chat uses Microsoft 365 Graph (work) or Web grounding via a Work/Web toggle within the chat interface, just like you can at microsoft365.com/chat. Web grounding will be available for all commercial Microsoft 365 customers, while Graph grounding will require a Copilot for Microsoft 365 license.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Engage - Recommended comments
CurrentVersion.description: Viva Engage will offer a new way to see contributions from close contacts and leaders within conversation threads. In the home feed, users see two comments that are meaningful to them and the overall conversation. Users can see the rest of the conversation with one click. There are no changes to the comment, reply, or reaction experiences with the new recommended comments feature.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Updated Hyperlink Insertion
CurrentVersion.description: You can now insert a hyperlink in your chat message text in fewer clicks. Select the text you want to display and paste the URL, without needing to use the traditional hyperlink dialog box.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft 365 admin center: AI administrator role
CurrentVersion.description: We are introducing a new admin role for AI and Microsoft Copilot administration. Admin users assigned with the AI Administrator role can efficiently manage Microsoft Copilot without the vast privileges of Global admin permissions.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: In-meeting Chat, Copilot, and Notes panes can be popped out from the meeting window
CurrentVersion.description: When you are in meetings or calls, you will be able to pop out, drag, and resize your meeting panes from the meeting window. This includes Chat, Copilot, and Notes side panes.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Data Loss Prevention - Admin units support for SharePoint Online
CurrentVersion.description: Delegate management and remediation authority for different people in different regions or organization units with role-based access control (RBAC). For example, German investigators should be able to investigate alerts and audit events for only German users. This update extends support to SharePoint for Microsoft 365.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft 365 app: Microsoft Places - Space analytics
CurrentVersion.description: Space analytics in Places provides dashboards for buildings, bookable rooms, and desk pools, providing a unified view of key metrics. Users can pick the space type of their interest and dive deeper to know more about its utilization.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft 365 app: Microsoft Places - Managed booking with Copilot
CurrentVersion.description: Building on booking suggestions, Copilot's managed booking feature rebooks room declines for single and recurring meetings, especially when room availability varies week to week. Additionally, Copilot will handle any changes, updates, and conflicts to guarantee a room for your meetings.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft 365 app: Microsoft Places - Intelligent suggestions in calendar
CurrentVersion.description: Intelligent suggestions will appear in the Places card in calendar and the Places people tab when users have actions to complete to organize their day. Users will be prompted to "quick book" rooms for in-person meetings and desks for in-office days. They will also see recommendations to update their work location to ‘Office’ when needed for in-person events.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Automatically set workplace presence to the building level in Teams
CurrentVersion.description: When you connect to peripherals in a bring your own device (BYOD) room or at a bookable desk, your workplace presence in Teams will automatically be set to the building level (if you and your admin have given permission), simplifying coordination with others and enabling AI-assisted booking in the future.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Archived Teams' schedules no longer visible
CurrentVersion.description: We've improved the schedule view by hiding archived teams' schedules. This reduces clutter, allowing you to focus on active teams and their schedules.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Audio support for screen sharing in immersive events
CurrentVersion.description: We're adding audio support for screen sharing in Microsoft Mesh. Presenters will now be able to choose whether they'd like to include system audio when starting a screen share in a Mesh event. This feature is available for presenters in Mesh with a Teams Premium license.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Town halls now available in GCC-High
CurrentVersion.description: Set up and host large scale events across a GCC-High organization with the familiar Teams app you use for webinars and meetings using town hall. Town hall capabilities include a new meeting template, capacity for up to 10k attendees, green room, the ability to manage what attendees see, RTMP-in, live translated captions, and more.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Town halls in GCC-High (Premium)
CurrentVersion.description: Set up and host large scale events across a GCC-High organization with the familiar Teams app you use for meetings using town hall. Town hall capabilities include a new meeting template, capacity for up to 20k attendees, green room, the ability to manage what attendees see, RTMP-in, live translated captions, and more.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Microsoft Copilot Dashboard Scope Filter enhancements
CurrentVersion.description: Introducing exciting new features to help you better understand and improve adoption and impact of Copilot for Microsoft 365 through the Copilot Dashboard. Enhancements include supporting multi-select capabilities for Scope filters to facilitate group comparisons and the ability to upload HR organizational data for Scope filter updates.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft 365 app: Microsoft Places
CurrentVersion.description: Microsoft Places is an AI-powered workplace app for flexible work, empowering hybrid employees to foster in-office collaboration and leveraging insights into space optimization. Places intelligently allows you to coordinate your hybrid team to make the most of in-office days, modernize how employees make connections, and optimize space management with occupancy and utilization data.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Math Progress
CurrentVersion.description: Accelerate student math skills with Microsoft Teams: Math Progress.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: iPad Multi-Window Support
CurrentVersion.description: Teams now supports multiple windows on iPad. Effortlessly organize your Split View experience with two Teams windows to easily navigate across meetings, chats, and more.

CurrentVersion.title: Outlook: Reset people suggestions in Outlook search for GCC, GCC High, and DoD
CurrentVersion.description: This feature will allow users to reset, export, and/or opt out of people suggestions in search through settings in the Outlook on the web and the new Outlook for Windows. When a reset is done, all versions of Outlook will reflect the change. This feature is already available in worldwide multitenant and will now be available for customers in GCC, GCC High, and DoD #newoutlookforwindows

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: eDiscovery - EXPORT ENHANCEMENTS
CurrentVersion.description: With the export of data being one of the core fundamentals of the solution, Microsoft Purview eDiscovery team is excited to announce significant changes coming to the export feature along with the new user experience in purview.microsoft.com. Key changes with export enhancements: The biggest change being introduced is that with the new user experience for eDiscovery where Standard and Premium cases have unified structure, the export is also aligned for both the streams – thereby providing a singular experience to customers. The behavior is now unified across all export jobs - same download experience, some report experience, same error messages. For Standard customers, the need to install a clickonce application in their machine and use that tool to download data for exporting in azure storage is history. Now, in the new experience, customers don’t need to install the app anymore and can download directly through browser. Additionally, customers will experience a faster export capability in the new portal driven through enhancements in backend architecture and optimized partition.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Allow Presenters to moderate Q&A
CurrentVersion.description: Organizers of town halls and webinars can now select and assign presenters to also be Q&A moderators, allowing them to manage and publish questions asked during the event. This feature lets organizers make changes to the group of moderators at any time, before or during the event, and it is available to all users organizing a town hall or webinar, regardless of license.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Data Security Posture Management for AI
CurrentVersion.description:
Microsoft Purview AI Hub is released to general availability. Along with this release, the name has been rebranded to Microsoft Purview Data Security Posture Management for AI (DSPM for AI) and capabilities have been added that include supporting admin units, displaying AI policies that were created in Purview solutions, and supporting additional AI apps. A version of DSPM for AI is also available to additional licensing, specifically Microsoft 365 E3 and Microsoft 365 Copilot licenses. 

The AI hub in Microsoft Purview is a centralized location to gain insights into generative AI activity, including the sensitive data flowing in AI prompts, both for Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365 and non-Microsoft AI applications.

CurrentVersion.title: Outlook: Copilot chat-assisted scheduling
CurrentVersion.description: Copilot now helps you schedule simple meetings such as 1:1s and focus time. Just ask Copilot to find some time with someone in your org and it will find the optimal time. #newoutlookforwindows

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Insider Risk Management - New Insider Risk Management reporting capabilities
CurrentVersion.description:
Insider risk management is introducing one central location for all reports including analytics and user activity reports. Additional reports will also be available that will summarize trends in alerts generated and cases created. Sample reports include alerts generated over time, alerts actioned over time, alerts and cases generated by region and department, top triggering events of alerts generated, and average time to triage alerts and cases.

The ability to filter reports will also be introduced. 

Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management correlates various signals to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks, such as IP theft, data leakage, and security violations. Insider Risk Management enables customers to create policies based on their own internal policies, governance, and organizational requirements. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft 365 admin center: New Feature access management UI in Admin Center
CurrentVersion.description: Through the new Feature Access management user interface, admins will be able to manage feature access settings directly in Microsoft 365 admin center. Feature access management allows admins to use access policies to manage which users can access specific features in Viva apps, so you can tailor your deployments to meet your local regulatory or business requirements. Previously, these policies could only be managed with Microsoft PowerShell cmdlets. After this rollout, admins can choose to use either Microsoft 365 admin center or PowerShell to manage feature access. Existing policies set for an organization will persist and can be managed in both places.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Shared tab in channel
CurrentVersion.description: he Files tab in channels is now "Shared". In addition to files that are currently shown from document library, new experience will also show all the files and links shared in the channel conversations. This makes it easier to find content all in one place.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Enhanced spell check with multi-language support
CurrentVersion.description: Enhanced spell check will help ensure that your messages are clear and professional. When you type your message in the Teams compose box, any issue found will be marked. You can then choose to correct them from options suggested in a dropdown menu, ignore them or add to dictionary. With multi-language support, you can switch between up to three languages.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot Analytics available in Microsoft 365 Copilot
CurrentVersion.description: Copilot Analytics is designed to empower every IT and business leader to measure adoption and business impact of Copilot and agents with out-of-the-box experiences in Copilot Dashboard and customizable reporting for deeper analysis against your KPIs. With Viva Insights included, IT admins and analysts can now tailor advanced prebuilt Copilot reports with their business data or create custom reports with organizational attributes, longer usage data sets, and more granular controls.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft 365: Updated settings for the Microsoft 365 app on Windows
CurrentVersion.description: The Microsoft 365 app on Windows added settings to pin the app to the taskbar.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Cross Cloud collaboration in VDI
CurrentVersion.description: VDI users can join meetings with people in other Microsoft 365 cloud environments (e.g., a user in GCCH joining a meeting in commercial, GCC or DOD) through three options: authenticated access via cross-cloud meeting connection, authenticated access using a guest account, or anonymous access. These scenarios require Slimcore-based optimization, as WebRTC-based optimization does not support meetings across different cloud environments.

CurrentVersion.title: Outlook: Message recall in the Outlook app for iOS and Android
CurrentVersion.description: From the Outlook for iOS and Android apps, you can request Outlook to attempt to recall a message sent to a colleague within your organization

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Insider Risk Management - Downgrade/remove sensitivity label
CurrentVersion.description:
This feature is an enhancement to the existing IRM Office Indicator. In the current version, only sensitivity label changes on the SharePoint Web app are captured in IRM. With the latest update, this indicator captures the sensitivity label changes (downgrade/ remove) when performed on OneDrive, AIP, and Endpoint (SharePoint file opened in Office app, or any sensitivity label change on the local files on your device).

Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management correlates various signals to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks such as IP theft, data leakage and security violations. Insider Risk Management enables customers to create policies based on their own internal policies, governance and organizational requirements. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Approvals in Teams within DoD
CurrentVersion.description: Users within DoD will now be able to use the Approvals app within Microsoft Teams.

CurrentVersion.title: Windows 365: Concurrency assignment for Windows 365 Frontline in dedicated mode
CurrentVersion.description: Concurrency assignment in Windows 365 Frontline in dedicated mode refers to the number of active Cloud PCs that can be used simultaneously within the total number of licensed Cloud PC usage for Frontline. This allocation ensures that resources are optimized based on the specific needs of the organization and its users.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot in Excel with Python for Web
CurrentVersion.description: Using everyday language, ask Copilot to perform advanced analytics that would usually take you hours or is beyond your skillset like machine learning, predictive forecasting, and more. Copilot will write Python code for you and insert it on the grid, resulting in deeper insights and stunning visuals. Now available for Web in all supported languages.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot in Excel with Python for Web
CurrentVersion.description: Using everyday language, ask Copilot to perform advanced analytics that would usually take you hours or is beyond your skillset like machine learning, predictive forecasting, and more. Copilot will write Python code for you and insert it on the grid, resulting in deeper insights and stunning visuals. Available on Excel for the Web in English, Simplified Chinese, French, German, Italian, Japanese, Brazilian Portuguese, and Spanish, with additional languages coming soon.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Endpoint Data Loss Prevention - Microsoft Purview Endpoint DLP blanket protections for unscannable file types
CurrentVersion.description:
Purview Endpoint DLP supports a set of specific file extensions and types. For file extensions not listed in this document, customers must use the 'File extension is' or 'File type is' rule condition. However, this approach can be challenging, as it requires manually enumerate all desired file extensions. This feature will enable protection for files outside the standard Purview Endpoint DLP monitoring scope.
More info: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/purview/dlp-create-deploy-policy?tabs=purview#scenario-3-apply-controls-to-supported-files-that-fail-scanning

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Data Lifecycle Management - Introduction of secure workflow to bypass legal holds and retention policies in Exchange
CurrentVersion.description: The first release of Priority cleanup enables admins to create a recurring exception to delete items under a broader retention policy and/or legal hold on Exchange workload. Creating a Priority cleanup will require a separate security role, multiple approvers, and will have a complete audit trail

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Ad-hoc individual desk booking in Teams
CurrentVersion.description: While previously able to reserve a spot within a desk pool, now you can book an individual desk when plugging into a shared desk peripheral. In addition, IT admins can get valuable individual desk utilization data in the Teams Rooms Pro Management portal making flexible work environments better for users and IT. This feature requires a Teams Premium license.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Ad-hoc individual desk booking in Teams
CurrentVersion.description: While previously able to reserve a spot within a desk pool, now you can book an individual desk when plugging into a shared desk peripheral. In addition, IT admins can get valuable individual desk utilization data in the Teams Rooms Pro Management portal making flexible work environments better for users and IT. This feature requires a Teams Premium license.

CurrentVersion.title: Outlook: FSLogix support for the new Outlook for Windows
CurrentVersion.description:
FSLogix support for the new Outlook for Windows includes registering the new Outlook for Windows package by family name and persisting the user data in LocalAppData. It will allow the roaming of user data in new Outlook for non-persistent VDI. #newoutlookforwindows
More info: https://learn.microsoft.com/microsoft-365-apps/outlook/get-started/virtualized-desktop-infrastructure

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Engage - Community replies and reactions in Teams
CurrentVersion.description: Users with the Viva Engage app in Teams will now receive notifications when others reply or react to their posts.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot extensibility – Developers can build custom engine agents with the Microsoft 365 Agents SDK
CurrentVersion.description: Developers can use the Microsoft 365 Agents SDK to create custom engine agents. These agents, built on their own AI stack, can be deployed to various platforms, including Microsoft 365 Copilot, Microsoft Teams, and other non-Microsoft channels.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot Extensibility -  Automatic project scaffolding in Teams Toolkit for building Graph connectors
CurrentVersion.description: Developers can now leverage an automatic project scaffolding for Graph connector applications within the Teams Toolkit, allowing for the generation of a full production-ready Graph connector application from just an API description file, significantly reducing setup time and complexity.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot extensibility – Developers can use TypeSpec as an authoring experience
CurrentVersion.description: Developers can use TypeSpec as an authoring experience for declarative agents and API plugins in Teams Toolkit.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Copilot extensibility – Copilot Chat developer mode
CurrentVersion.description: Developers can use Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat and enable developer mode to debug.

CurrentVersion.title: Excel: Python in Excel
CurrentVersion.description: Python in Excel allows you to bring the capabilities of Python directly into the Excel grid. As a part of this feature, users with access to Excel for Windows will be able to add Python formulas directly into their workbooks without any installation required. These Python formulas will be run by Excel in a secure container on the Microsoft Cloud with enterprise-level security as a compliant Microsoft 365 connected experience.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Data Loss Prevention- OCR Cost Estimator Support for MAC Endpoints
CurrentVersion.description: OCR Cost Estimator allows you to estimate the potential cost for using Optical Character Recognition. This means that you will no longer be required to set up an Azure Subscription for billing first and can accurately estimate the cost you would have incurred while using OCR. This will help you to identify the optimal configuration settings for OCR as per your requirements. Cost Estimator can be used for 30 days and will not scan images for sensitive content.

CurrentVersion.title: Excel: Refresh queries from Authenticated Data Sources in Excel for the Web
CurrentVersion.description: You can now refresh Power Query data from data sources that require authentication in Excel for the Web.

CurrentVersion.title: Bookings: ''Cc" functionality to email notifications
CurrentVersion.description: "CC" additional email addresses on confirmation & reminder emails for 1:1 & N:1 appointments.
